review_text:
I am not one to leave bad reviews, but this one is long overdue and 100% warranted. My experience with Henderson Properties has been the following:

I am a property manager and manage a townhome that Henderson is the HOA for, and originally reported a maintenance issue in FEBRUARY 2020.

The issue is on the exterior of the property, where water is getting inside the townhome and damaging the interior of the home. I have sent extensive photos, left voicemails for the community representative, sent dozens of emails. and have yet to receive a response with any substance. The property damage is getting worse and worse, and Henderson keeps neglecting overdue exterior maintenance.

Every time I have reached out to Henderson staff Via email or phone call for an update, I received one of two responses: "We are waiting on board approval", or "We are currently out of the office". Seems like they are out of the office every week. Since I have had this outstanding maintenance request, the community manager has changed 4 times!! (I guess everyone is quitting - I don't blame them).

We are now in December, and have yet to get a resolution, or any sort of game plan on what action will be taken to address these issues.

If you are thinking of purchasing a property where Henderson is the HOA. you might want to think again. They will charge you your HOA dues, while mismanaging your community, and letting your property slowly deteriorate.

Note to Henderson Staff: I really am a nice guy, a only trying to do my job as a property manager and take care of issues at my clients rental property. So, PLEASE, lets close out this issue so we can all move on with our lives.
owner_answer: We understand your frustration with this situation Mr. Goncharov.  Please know that the responsibility of exterior maintenance for the community is governed by the association’s CC&R’s and will lie with either the HOA or the homeowner.  Maintenance for areas belonging to the association that exceed a certain threshold must be approved by the board of directors. The estimate for this repair does.  The estimate for this repair has previously been presented to the board for their review, along with additional pictures per their request, and we are awaiting board approval to move forward. As the management company for the association, Henderson Properties is not permitted to take additional action on this repair without the board’s approval. The Community Association Manager is working with the board to get this resolved as quickly as possible.

review_text:
Henderson Properties is terrible. Their work methods are unprofessional. Following are some examples:

When I sold my house, they charged $286 to provide a statement of HoA dues. Can you believe that?? Almost $300 to print out a statement.

After I had lived in my house for 10 years, I received a letter from them stating my mailbox was not compliant (it looks the same but there was a flower imprint missing from the door). I could either replace it for $700 or they would place a lien on my home. Really? The house was built 25 years ago - NOW it's time to do a mailbox inspection? The mailbox was the same one from when we bought the home 11 years earlier and looked perfect.

They are constantly drumming up ways to make themselves appear relevant.:

Mud from the empty lot next door had collected at the end of my driveway - got a threatening letter about that. Wasn't even my lot producing the runoff but I was threatened. And - why was this even an issue?  If I'm okay with some mud collecting at the bottom of my driveway, why should they care??

We sprayed the lawn for some type of weeds - got a threatening letter about the grass that was killed. I guess they think grass should grow itself back overnight. I have never dealt with a company like Henderson Properties.

My driveway had a crack - (you know what's coming) - I got a threatening letter. Either repair the driveway or they would fine me and put a lien against my home.

We have a very nice home. We take care of our property. From the letters from Henderson, you would think I was living in a rundown shack.

I will never live in a neighborhood that is managed by Henderson Properties again. Funny, when I talked to my closing attorney about how annoyed I was about the $286 charge for printing out a statement, she said Henderson Properties was one of the worst. Made me feel a little better - it's not just me.
owner_answer: We’re sorry to hear you’ve not had a positive experience with our company.  Henderson Properties is the management company for your association and works in conjunction with your community’s covenants and takes direction from the community’s Board of Directors, including the mailbox inspection program.  HOA documents needed for real estate closings are provided and billed from a third-party company, not Henderson Properties. Violation courtesy letters are on behalf of the HOA, and not intended to be threatening, but rather an effort to uphold properties to the community standards. Our records do show that additional time was granted for the lawn to recover. We wish you the best.
